CatDescriptText: Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1964, pg. 24, reads: "Record-Smashing Bucco - During the 77-year existence of a National League club in Pittsburgh, only one of the 418 contract-signing pitchers - during all those years - managed to fan more than 12 batsmen in any single game.  That one Bucco is 'Bullet Bob' Veale, posed above for a Courier cameraman.  Bob fanned 15 for a new record, two weeks ago, and (with 229 strikeouts at press time) is the lone Bucco ever to fan more than 200 men in one season.  Only Bob (2.92) and Al McBean (2.03) held rival teams to under 3.00, during 80 or more innings, this season."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player no. 39 Bob Veale, wearing eyeglasses and glove, posed throwing pitch on Forbes Field
